action.action-desc: Mr. Frost introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To establish the Office of Gun Violence Prevention, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Office of Gun Violence Prevention Act of 2023.

paragraph.text: The term Advisory Council means the advisory council established under section 3(c)(1).
The term Director means the Director of the Office.
The term gun violence includes homicide, violent crime, domestic violence, attempted suicide, suicide, and unintentional death or injury involving a firearm.
The term Office means the Office of Gun Violence Prevention established under section 3(a).
The Attorney General shall establish within the Office of Legal Policy of the Department of Justice the Office of Gun Violence Prevention.
The Attorney General shall appoint a Director to be the head of the Office.

The Director, in consultation with the Advisory Council, shall coordinate, integrate, and maximize the efficacy of each responsibility, program, and service relating to gun violence prevention administered by the Attorney General to maximize an integrated approach to reducing gun violence and serving victims of gun violence, including—

subparagraph.text: the responsibilities of the heads of the Criminal and Civil Divisions of the Department of Justice, the Director of the Office of Community Oriented Policing Services, each United States Attorney, Director of the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives, the Director of the Office on Violence Against Women, the Director of the Office of Victims of Crime, and the Director of the Office of Justice Programs; and
the administration of the national instant criminal background check system established under section 103 of the Brady Handgun Violence Prevention Act (34 U.S.C. 40901).

paragraph.text: The Director, in consultation with the Advisory Council, shall evaluate laws, regulations, Federal programs, offices, data sources, and grant programs relating to gun violence prevention administered by the Attorney General to assess how each such law, regulation, Federal program, office, data source, and grant program can be maximized, modernized, and coordinated to reduce gun violence.

The Director shall recommend to Congress and the President legislative and executive policy options to promote evidence-based gun violence prevention strategies, including the implementation of existing laws, regulations, and grant programs.
The Director, in consultation with the Advisory Council, shall—

subparagraph.text: identify gaps in available data needed for gun violence prevention research, policy development, and the implementation of evidence-based gun violence prevention strategies; and
develop a plan to collect and analyze the data described in subparagraph (A).

paragraph.text: The Director, in consultation with the Advisory Council, shall assess ongoing research efforts of the Department of Justice relating to gun violence to establish a comprehensive research agenda on the causes and solutions of gun violence.

The Director, in consultation with the Advisory Council, shall educate the general public about Federal laws, regulations, and grant programs relating to gun violence prevention, including by conducting education and awareness campaigns—

subparagraph.text: directed at—

clause.text: owners of firearms;
parents and legal guardians of minors; and
professionals who provide services to individuals and communities disproportionately impacted by gun violence; and

subparagraph.text: that include education relating to the secure storage or firearms and suicide prevention.

paragraph.text: In carrying out the duties under this subsection, the Director shall coordinate with Federal agencies and commissions that have jurisdiction over gun violence prevention, including—

subparagraph.text: the Department of Health and Human Services;
the Department of Veterans Affairs;
the Department of Education;
the Department of Housing and Urban Development;
the Department of Commerce;
the Department of Homeland Security;
the Department of Defense;
the Department of the Interior;
the Consumer Product Safety Commission;
the Federal Trade Commission; and
the United States Sentencing Commission.

paragraph.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, and annually thereafter, the Director shall submit to Congress a report that includes—

subparagraph.text: information on the state of gun violence in the United States;
recommendations for policy initiatives and legislation to reduce gun violence in the United States; and
a description of the efforts of the Director to carry out the duties under this subsection.

paragraph.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, and not less frequently than quarterly thereafter, the Attorney General shall convene an advisory council—

subparagraph.text: chaired by the Director; and
the membership of which includes the following individuals or a designee of the individual:

clause.text: The Deputy Attorney General.
The Associate Attorney General.
The Assistant Attorney General for the Office of Legal Policy.
The Assistant Attorney General for the Office of Justice Programs.
The Assistant Attorney General for the Criminal Division.
The Director of the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives.
The Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation.
The Director of the Bureau of Justice Assistance.
The Director of the Office on Violence Against Women.
The Director of the Office of Victims of Crime.
The Director of the Bureau of Justice Statistics.
The Director of the National Institute of Justice.

subparagraph.text: The Director shall make every reasonable effort to include as members of the Advisory Council not fewer than 12 additional individuals.
The additional members described in subparagraph (A) shall include not fewer than 1—

clause.text: survivor of gun violence;
community violence intervention service provider;
public health official;
medical professional who provides trauma care;
mental health clinician;
official from a department of justice of a State;
State or local public health department official;
teacher;
member of a student group; and
veteran.

subsection.text: There are authorized to be appropriated such sums as are necessary to carry out this section.
